critique: This document primarily deals with the delegation of authority related to energy administration and petroleum allocation. It establishes the Federal Energy Administration and transfers powers related to energy regulation. There's a moderate increase in executive power due to the delegation of authority to the Administrator. The document centralizes control at the federal level. There is government intervention in the economy through the allocation and control of energy resources. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, focus on national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion.
